definition: Relations involving fundamental metaphysical connections like causation, dependence, constitution, and part-whole structures.

positive_examples: The mind supervenes on the brain, so no mental change can occur without physical change.
If the butterfly hadn't flapped its wings, the hurricane wouldn't have formed.
The software process is constituted by the underlying hardware computations.
The wheel is part of the bicycle, which enables its function.
Higher-level economic patterns are realized by individual market transactions.
The explosion caused the building to collapse through structural failure.
negative_examples: John is taller than Mary by six inches.
The red car is located next to the blue house.
Shakespeare wrote Hamlet in the early 1600s.
The population of Tokyo is greater than that of London.
This apple tastes sweeter than that orange.
The meeting is scheduled for 3 PM tomorrow.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: SpatialRelation, TemporalRelation, QuantitativeRelation, SocialRelation
